column1:
RohanBeckett,"2010-11-17T07:02:31.473Z","A good way to sort and store a small collection","

I got this for Christmas one year, from my grandparents... and 3 blue, and 1 red tray from some other Aunts/Uncles.

<div>It was great to have a genuine Lego storage cabinet... Unfortunately, by that time in my life (probably aged around 10 years old), I already had FAR too much LEGO to fit/sort into these drawers!&nbsp
column2: So I still needed plenty of ice-cream tubs, and other containers to store it in.

column1: <div>Eventually all the lego went into a large home-made mat/sheet, (similar to the Lego drawstring bag), but I still used the drawers/cabinet for a lot of the small/rare parts, so they&nbsp

column3: ... White laminated chipboard, pre-drilled holes, and an allen-key to assemble the cabinet.

column1: I think it's still in my fathers shed to this day! 25+ years old!

jks2509,"2019-01-08T15:18:47.537Z","Storage abinet","

This storage cabinet from 1984 was advertised in the Dutch catalogue as a '
column3: to store your stackable storage trays in. The cabinet fits 4 trays, that came in red or blue. It certainly was sturdy, as the cabinet owned by my husband from 1984, with 4 trays, is still in daily&nbsp
column4: use by our own children now. The cabinet can be used neatly to display a range of smaller newly-built sets.
